    Namespace: Spine.Unity
    Assembly: spine-unity.dll
    Syntax
    [ExecuteInEditMode]
[AddComponentMenu("Spine/SkeletonAnimation")]
public class SkeletonAnimation : SkeletonRenderer, ISkeletonComponent, IHasSkeletonDataAsset, ISkeletonAnimation, IAnimationStateComponent

    Fields

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    loop

    Whether or not AnimationName should loop. This only applies to the initial animation specified in the inspector, or any subsequent Animations played through .AnimationName. Animations set through state.SetAnimation are unaffected.

    Declaration
    public bool loop
    Field Value
    Type Description
    Boolean
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    state

    This is the Spine.AnimationState object of this SkeletonAnimation. You can control animations through it. Note that this object, like .skeleton, is not guaranteed to exist in Awake. Do all accesses and caching to it in Start

    Declaration
    public AnimationState state
    Field Value
    Type Description
    AnimationState
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    timeScale

    The rate at which animations progress over time. 1 means 100%. 0.5 means 50%.

    Declaration
    public float timeScale
    Field Value
    Type Description
    Single
    Remarks

    AnimationState and TrackEntry also have their own timeScale. These are combined multiplicatively.

    Properties

    | Improve this Doc View Source

    AnimationName

    Setting this property sets the animation of the skeleton. If invalid, it will store the animation name for the next time the skeleton is properly initialized. Getting this property gets the name of the currently playing animation. If invalid, it will return the last stored animation name set through this property.

    Declaration
    public string AnimationName { get; set; }
    Property Value
    Type Description
    String
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    AnimationState

    This is the Spine.AnimationState object of this SkeletonAnimation. You can control animations through it. Note that this object, like .skeleton, is not guaranteed to exist in Awake. Do all accesses and caching to it in Start

    Declaration
    public AnimationState AnimationState { get; }
    Property Value
    Type Description
    AnimationState

    ClearState()

    Clears the previously generated mesh, resets the skeleton's pose, and clears all previously active animations.

    Declaration
    public override void ClearState()
    Overrides

    Initialize(Boolean)

    Initialize this component. Attempts to load the SkeletonData and creates the internal Spine objects and buffers.

    Declaration
    public override void Initialize(bool overwrite)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Boolean overwrite

    If set to true, force overwrite an already initialized object.

    SkeletonAnimation

    The newly instantiated SkeletonAnimation component.
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    Update(Single)

    Progresses the AnimationState according to the given deltaTime, and applies it to the Skeleton. Use Time.deltaTime to update manually. Use deltaTime 0 to update without progressing the time.

    Declaration
    public void Update(float deltaTime)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Single deltaTime

    Declaration
    protected event UpdateBonesDelegate _UpdateWorld
    Event Type
    Type Description
    UpdateBonesDelegate
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    UpdateComplete

    Occurs after the Skeleton's bone world space values are resolved (including all constraints). Use this callback if you want to use bone world space values, but don't intend to modify bone local values. This callback can also be used when setting world position and the bone matrix.

    Declaration
    public event UpdateBonesDelegate UpdateComplete
    Event Type
    Type Description
    UpdateBonesDelegate
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    UpdateLocal

    Occurs after the animations are applied and before world space values are resolved. Use this callback when you want to set bone local values.

    Declaration
    public event UpdateBonesDelegate UpdateLocal
    Event Type
    Type Description
    UpdateBonesDelegate
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    UpdateWorld

    Occurs after the Skeleton's bone world space values are resolved (including all constraints). Using this callback will cause the world space values to be solved an extra time. Use this callback if want to use bone world space values, and also set bone local values.

    Declaration
    public event UpdateBonesDelegate UpdateWorld
    Event Type
    Type Description
    UpdateBonesDelegate
